alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 28 at 10:34AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, Floyd and Pike. * WHEN...Until 1230 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1032 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to slow-moving showers. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain has fallen since 9:30 aM. Up to an additional inch of rainfall is expected between 10:30 and 11:30 AM. This will cause minor flooding of creeks and streams, roads, and roadside culverts. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Prestonsburg, Allen, Ivel, Alvin, Banner, Emma, McCombs, Allen City, Dwale, Gulnare, Beaver Junction and Arkansas.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
